description: Cinema Entertainments (Private) Limited and other Vs National Film Corporation of Sri Lanka and others before Hon.M. Sampath K. B. Wijeratne J.
parties: Cinema Entertainments (Private) Limited and other Vs National Film Corporation of Sri Lanka and others
judgement_by: Hon.M. Sampath K. B. Wijeratne J.
keywords: Writ of certiorari and mandamus, Exclusive right to distribute, import and exhibit films,  Cabinet decision to allow private circuits to carry out the above,  NFC entered into agreements with the private circuits,  subsequent change of policy,  cancelled the previous cabinet decision end result of futility frustration,  injustice and illegality in a writ application,  Contractual relationships of commercial nature,  Ordinarily writ will not lie,  Alternative remedy available under the law of contract,   Yet courts have granted writs where the transaction is overshadowed by an administrative malady that made to be remedied,
legistation: Article 140 of the Constitution. Section 5 (d), 57 of the State Film Corporation Act No. 47 of 1971.
